item.title: Help whit command

item.description:
@nerd123456789 wrote:

so do i have to delete && (c.playerRights >= 2) and why is the if statement wrong ?

Read full topic

item.title: Help whit command
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Because you have this check:

&& (c.playerRights >= 2)

so when a player with the player rights of 0 does the command, it is returned to the method before your other if block is executed.

Also, your if statement is wrong. opening brace { closing brace } you used a semicolon.

Read full topic

item.title: Help whit command
item.dc:creator: @nerd123456789 ...nerd123456789
item.description:
@nerd123456789 wrote:

ok so first im a beginner coder so i’ll explain now so i want to make it so when a normal player do ::copy it says you dont have permissions so i added some code to test so i multi login on two accounts 1 admin account and 1 normal account then i try to do ::copy whit my normal account but it doesnt work and when i do it whit the admin account it copys the armour of the normal account + says you dont have permissions how do i fix this? code below

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“copy”) && (c.playerRights >= 2)) {
int[] arm = new int[14];
String name = playerCommand.substring(5);
for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) {
if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) {
Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j];
if(c2.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerCommand.substring(5))){
for(int q = 0; q < c2.playerEquipment.length; q++) {
arm[q] = c2.playerEquipment[q];
c.playerEquipment[q] = c2.playerEquipment[q];
}
for(int q = 0; q < arm.length; q++) {
c.getItems().setEquipment(arm[q],1,q);
}
if(c.playerRights == 0);<-------//this is the code
c.sendMessage(“you dont have permissions to use this command”);
}

Read full topic
